meanings.definition: The act of steering a racing shell in crew racing.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the coxing helped the team stay on course.
meanings.sent2: The coxing skillfully guided the boat through the water.
meanings.sent3: The coxing made sure the boat didn't crash into other teams.
meanings.sent4: Her coxing was like a compass, always pointing the team in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The coxing's commands echoed across the water, guiding the crew to victory.

meanings.definition: The act of motivating or directing a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The coxing inspired the team to give their best effort.
meanings.sent2: Her coxing skills brought unity and focus to the group.
meanings.sent3: The coxing's pep talks always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: His coxing was like a beacon, leading the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The coxing's enthusiasm was contagious, lifting the spirits of the entire group.
